titleStmt.title: England's gratulation for the King and his subjects happy union. First preach't on the day of publique thanksgiving, appointed by the Parliament, May the 10th. 1660. Since publish't as a common tribute to Cæsar, at his so much long'd for arrival. By R. Mossom, preacher of Gods Word at S. Pet. P. Wh. London
titleStmt.author: Mossom, Robert, d. 1679.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Tho: Newcomb, for William Grantham, at the Black Bear in St. Pauls Church-yard near the little north door,

notesStmt.note: First line of title page in three settings: title begins (1) "England's", (2) "Englands'", or (3) "Englands".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Black Bear in St. Pauls Church-yard near the little north door
